Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column- krater. Bust of a bearded man to left, red on his hair (a fillet?), beard, and chest.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Lydos ((Venit))
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Painter of Louvre F 6. The man's profile with its longish nose and pursed lips recalls profiles by the painter, the round eye and the simple hook for the ear can be paralleled on a fragmentary handle plate from Naukratis, Oxford G 125 (ABV 125, 24; CVA Great Britain 9: pl. 12 fig. 10); the line of the hair over the shoulder and the red fillet and beard are found on another Naukratis fragment, Oxford G 577 (ABV 124, 21; CVA Great Britain 9: pl. 12 fig. 7).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 77, no. 258, pl. 58)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1066)
